title: Honoring Mary Louise Meisenzahl upon the occasion of her retirement from Monroe County's Office of Emergency Management
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Mary Louise Meisenzahl upon the occasion
of her retirement from Monroe County's Office of Emergency Management

WHEREAS,  This  Legislative  Body seeks to acknowledge those individuals
whose professional lives and civic endeavors serve to enhance the  stat-
ure of the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Mary
Louise Meisenzahl upon the occasion of her retirement from Monroe  Coun-
ty's  Office  of  Emergency  Management,  to be celebrated on Wednesday,
January 19, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 25 years, Mary Louise Meisenzahl rendered faith-
ful, conscientious and valuable service to Monroe County; and
  WHEREAS, Affectionately known as "Muffy", Mary Louise  Meisenzahl  has
been  an  exemplary county emergency manager and has been a leader among
her peers in public safety, both regionally and statewide; and
  WHEREAS, Mary Louise Meisenzahl designed a  state-of-the  art  program
area  within  the  Monroe  County  Public  Safety Training Facility that
serves as a model to counties both large and small; she  has  served  as
Administrator of the Office of Emergency Management since 1992; prior to
that, she served as a 911 program analyst for four years; and
  WHEREAS,  With more than 30 years of public service, Mary Louise Meis-
enzahl was Mayor of the Village of Honeoye  Falls  from  1981-1990,  and
prior to that was a village trustee for two years; a resident of Honeoye
Falls, she currently serves as president of the Emergency Managers Asso-
ciation of Western New York; and
  WHEREAS, Earning her Bachelor of Science degree in Education from SUNY
Cortland  and  her  Master of Public Administration from SUNY Brockport,
Mary Louise Meisenzahl is a Certified Emergency  Manager,  conferred  by
the  International  Association  of  Emergency  Managers;  she also is a
member of the adjunct faculty at Monroe Community College for the Public
Safety Training Center and the Law and Criminal Justice Department; and
  WHEREAS, In her capacity  as  Administrator,  Mary  Louise  Meisenzahl
served with loyalty, honor and distinction; and
  WHEREAS,  In her official acts, Mary Louise Meisenzahl was governed by
a keen sense of duty and always showed a unique grasp of human problems;
she is a true asset to society; and
  WHEREAS, During her tenure with Monroe County, Mary Louise  Meisenzahl
earned  the  admiration,  esteem  and  affection of her colleagues; now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
honor  Mary  Louise  Meisenzahl upon the occasion of her retirement from
Monroe County's Office of Emergency Management; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Mary Louise Meisenzahl.
